intro: Chondrosum kayi, commonly known as the Kayi rock cress, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant features basal leaves that are often lobed or divided, and its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. It is native to specific regions in Central Asia and is adapted to harsh, high-altitude conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
